
::: {.question}

**Convertible Bond — Conversion Value vs. Straight Value (Premium/Discount)**

```{r}
#| eval: true
#| results: asis
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
set.seed(807)
ratio        <- round(runif(1, 18, 35), 0)
stock_price  <- round(runif(1, 25, 75), 2)
bond_price   <- round(runif(1, 900, 1250), 2)
conv_value   <- round(ratio * stock_price, 2)
premium      <- round(bond_price - conv_value, 2)

```


cat(sprintf("A convertible bond can be exchanged for <b>%d</b> shares. The stock trades at <b>$%1.2f</b> and the bond trades at <b>$%1.2f</b>.", 
            ratio, stock_price, bond_price))
            
1) What is the <strong>conversion value</strong> of the bond?  
2) What is the <strong>conversion premium</strong> (bond price − conversion value)? Use a negative sign if discount.

::: {.question-block}
